page.title: 09CURDWORTH LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: THE POPULATION OF CURDWORTH IS APPROXIMATELY ONE THOUSAND ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY TWO SOULS, COMPRISING EIGHT HUNDRED AND NINETYSEVEN ADULTS AND TWO HUNDRED AND SEVENTYFIVE CHILDREN. CONCERNING CURDWORTH GOVERNMENT, THE VILLAGE IS REPRESENTED BY MEMBER OF PARLIAMENT FOR NORTH WARWICKSHIRE, ONE COUNTY COUNCILLOR SHARED WITH WATER ORTON AND ONE BOROUGH COUNCILLOR, SEVEN PARISH COUNCILLORS AND A PARISH CLERK. OUR LOCAL ELECTED REPRESENTATIVES HAVE BEEN SYMPATHETIC TO THE EXTREME UPHEAVAL CAUSED TO VILLAGERS, PARTICULARLY THOSE WHOSE HOMES AND DAILY LIVES HAVE BEEN AFFECTED, BY THE BUILDING OF A SECTION OF THE MOTORWAY. THE MOTORWAY HAS CAUSED SEVERE ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE AND WAS PARTIALLY ROUTED THROUGH CURDWORTH IN SPITE OF LOCAL COUNCILLORS OBJECTIONS.
